alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 11:51AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT/2 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Franklin. In Panhandle Florida, Gulf. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT /200 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 AM EDT /1050 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port St. Joe, Odena, Thirteen Mile, Jones Homestead, Ward Ridge, Eleven Mile, Indian Pass, Simmons Bayou, Nine Mile, Tilton and Cape San Blas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
